question: Question_A_13
sols:
The first line of code creates the 3 by 3 zeros matrix:

\[A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \end{array}\right]\]

Then we enter the for-loop. In the first iteration, the entry
\emph{A(1,1)} is set to \emph{-5} and \emph{A(1,2)} is set to \emph{1},
resulting in

\[A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} {\color{green} -5} & {\color{green} 1} & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0 \\ 0 & 0 & 0\end{array}\right]\]

In the second iteration the entry \emph{A(2,2)} is set to \emph{-5} and
\emph{A(2,3)} is set to \emph{1}, hence

\[A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} -5 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & {\color{green} -5} & {\color{green} 1} \\ 0 & 0 & 0\end{array}\right]\]

Finally, the entry \emph{A(3,3)} is set to \emph{-2}. So the final
answer is

\[A = \left[\begin{array}{ccc} -5 & 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -5 & 1 \\ 0 & 0 & -2 \end{array}\right]\]
